--- layout: default title: GlaxoSmithKline 2014 Neurophysics Workshop on Skeptical Neuroimaging ---
Talks from the 14 January 2014 ''GlaxoSmithKline - Neurophysics Workshop on Skeptical Neuroimaging'', an activity hosted at Imperial College and coordinated with the Neurophysics Marie Curie Initial Training Network of which GSK is a participant.

Talks

This section lists all available GlaxoSmithKline 2014 Neurophysics Workshop on Skeptical Neuroimaging standalone talks by NISOx and NISOx collaborators.
  • Why should we be Skeptical Neuroscientists?
    Author: Paul Matthews. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5487175.v1
  • Overcoming confounds and improving the interpretability of connectivity analyses
    Author: Eugene Duff. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5487181.v1
  • Meta-analytic methods for neuroimaging data
    Author: Joaquim Radua. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5487184.v1
  • Advanced spatial Bayesian models for meta-analysis & reverse inference
    Authors: Thomas Nichols, Timothy Johnson. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5487187.v1
  • Neuroinformatic techniques for provenance & data sharing
    Author: Camille Maumet. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5487190.v1
  • NeuroVault and the vision for data sharing in neuroimaging
    Author: Chris Gorgolewski. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5487193.v1
  • Meta-analytic approaches to mapping the brain, its functions and connectivity
    Author: Simon Eickhoff. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5487196.v1
